questions.question: What is the empirical formula of as-synthesized SBMOF-2:H2O?
What is the maximum Xe adsorption capacity of SBMOF-2 at 298 K?
Does SBMOF-2 show higher adsorption selectivity for Xe over Kr?
What is the main reason for the Xe selectivity in SBMOF-2?
questions.answer: The specific geometry of the pores and the presence of polar −OH groups.

questions.question: Is the density of SBMOF-2 higher than 1.2 g/cm3?
What method was used to calculate the isosteric heat of adsorption?
Can SBMOF-2 maintain its structure after exposure to air for 5 days?
What is the role of −OH groups in SBMOF-2?
questions.answer: They serve as more polarizing parts in the network, resulting in higher occupancy of adsorbed noble gases.

questions.question: Is the productivity of SBMOF-2 for pure Kr higher than that of Ag@NiMOF-74?
What is the Langmuir-Freundlich parameter bA0 for Xe adsorption in SBMOF-2?
Does SBMOF-2 have a higher adsorption capacity for Xe compared to Kr?
What is the crystal system of as-synthesized SBMOF-2:H2O?
What is the main advantage of using SBMOF-2 for Xe/Kr separation over cryogenic distillation?
questions.answer: Efficient separation at near room temperature at very low pressure.

questions.question: Is the experimental breakthrough experiment consistent with the simulated breakthrough for SBMOF-2?
What is the main structural feature of SBMOF-2?
questions.answer: Isolated CaO6 octahedra connected by linkers.

questions.question: Does SBMOF-2 show a higher Xe adsorption capacity than Co formate?
What is the role of the dual-Langmuir-Freundlich model in the study?
questions.answer: It was used to fit the adsorption isotherms of Xe and Kr in SBMOF-2.

questions.question: Is the void space of type-I channels larger than that of type-II channels in SBMOF-2?
What is the main challenge in the cryogenic separation of noble gases?
questions.answer: It is energy-intensive and expensive, especially when low concentrations are involved.

questions.question: What is the significance of the −OH groups in the type-II channels of SBMOF-2?
questions.answer: They contribute to the differentiation of sorbed gases between type-I and type-II channels.
